t: Psalm 78
God’s Kindness to Rebellious Israel
A Contemplation of Asaph.
Give*pn ear, O my people, to*i my law; Incline*ld your ears to the words of my mouth.
I*ld will open my mouth in a parable; I*ld will utter dark sayings of old,
Which*ld we have heard and known, And*ld our fathers have told us.
We*ld will not hide them*i from their children, Telling*ld to the generation to come the praises of the Lord,*s And*ld His strength and His wonderful works that He has done.
For*ln He established a testimony in Jacob, And*ld appointed a law in Israel, Which*ld He commanded our fathers, That*ld they should make them known to their children;
That*ld the generation to come might know them,*i The*ld children who*i would be born, That*ild they may arise and declare them*i to their children,
That*ld they may set their hope in God, And*ld not forget the works of God, But*ld keep His commandments;
And*ld may not be like their fathers, A*ld stubborn and rebellious generation, A*ld generation that*i did not set its heart aright, And*ld whose spirit was not faithful to God.
The*ln children of Ephraim, being*i armed and*i carrying bows, Turned*ld back in the day of battle.
They*ld did not keep the covenant of God; They*ld refused to walk in His law,
And*ld forgot His works And*ld His wonders that He had shown them.
Marvelous*ln things He did in the sight of their fathers, In*ld the land of Egypt, in*i the field of Zoan.
He*ld divided the sea and caused them to pass through; And*ld He made the waters stand up like a heap.
In*ld the daytime also He led them with the cloud, And*ld all the night with a light of fire.
He*ld split the rocks in the wilderness, And*ld gave them*i drink in abundance like the depths.
He*ld also brought streams out of the rock, And*ld caused waters to run down like rivers.
But*ln they sinned even more against Him By*ld rebelling against the Most High in the wilderness.
And*ld they tested God in their heart By*ld asking for the food of their fancy.
Yes,*ld they spoke against God: They*ld said, “Can God prepare a table in the wilderness?
Behold,*ld He struck the rock, So*ld that the waters gushed out, And*ld the streams overflowed. Can*ld He give bread also? Can*ld He provide meat for His people?”
Therefore*ln the Lord*s heard this*i and was furious; So*ld a fire was kindled against Jacob, And*ld anger also came up against Israel,
Because*ld they did not believe in God, And*ld did not trust in His salvation.
Yet*ld He had commanded the clouds above, And*ld opened the doors of heaven,
Had*ld rained down manna on them to eat, And*ld given them of the bread of heaven.
Men*ld ate angels’ food; He*ld sent them food to the full.
He*ln caused an east wind to blow in the heavens; And*ld by His power He brought in the south wind.
He*ld also rained meat on them like the dust, Feathered*ld fowl like the sand of the seas;
And*ld He let them*i fall in the midst of their camp, All*ld around their dwellings.
So*ld they ate and were well filled, For*ld He gave them their own desire.
They*ld were not deprived of their craving; But*ld while their food was*i still in their mouths,
The*ld wrath of God came against them, And*ld slew the stoutest of them, And*ld struck down the choice men*i of Israel.
In*ln spite of this they still sinned, And*ld did not believe in His wondrous works.
Therefore*ld their days He consumed in futility, And*ld their years in fear.
When*ln He slew them, then they sought Him; And*ld they returned and sought earnestly for God.
Then*ld they remembered that God was*i their rock, And*ld the Most High God their Redeemer.
Nevertheless*ld they flattered Him with their mouth, And*ld they lied to Him with their tongue;
For*ld their heart was not steadfast with Him, Nor*ld were they faithful in His covenant.
But*ld He, being*i full of compassion, forgave their*i iniquity, And*ld did not destroy them.*i Yes,*ld many a time He turned His anger away, And*ld did not stir up all His wrath;
For*ld He remembered that they were*i but*i flesh, A*ld breath that passes away and does not come again.
How*ln often they provoked Him in the wilderness, And*ild grieved Him in the desert!
Yes,*ld again and again they tempted God, And*ld limited the Holy One of Israel.
They*ld did not remember His power: The*ld day when He redeemed them from the enemy,
When*ld He worked His signs in Egypt, And*ld His wonders in the field of Zoan;
Turned*ld their rivers into blood, And*ld their streams, that they could not drink.
He*ld sent swarms of flies among them, which devoured them, And*ld frogs, which destroyed them.
He*ld also gave their crops to the caterpillar, And*ld their labor to the locust.
He*ld destroyed their vines with hail, And*ld their sycamore trees with frost.
He*ld also gave up their cattle to the hail, And*ld their flocks to fiery lightning.
He*ld cast on them the fierceness of His anger, Wrath,*ld indignation, and trouble, By*ld sending angels of destruction among*i them.*i
He*ld made a path for His anger; He*ld did not spare their soul from death, But*ld gave their life over to the plague,
And*ld destroyed all the firstborn in Egypt, The*ld first of their*i strength in the tents of Ham.
But*ld He made His own people go forth like sheep, And*ld guided them in the wilderness like a flock;
And*ld He led them on safely, so that they did not fear; But*ld the sea overwhelmed their enemies.
And*ld He brought them to His holy border, This*ld mountain which*i His right hand had acquired.
He*ld also drove out the nations before them, Allotted*ld them an inheritance by survey, And*ld made the tribes of Israel dwell in their tents.
Yet*ln they tested and provoked the Most High God, And*ld did not keep His testimonies,
But*ld turned back and acted unfaithfully like their fathers; They*ld were turned aside like a deceitful bow.
For*ld they provoked Him to anger with their high places, And*ld moved Him to jealousy with their carved images.
When*ld God heard this,*i He was furious, And*ld greatly abhorred Israel,
So*ld that He forsook the tabernacle of Shiloh, The*ld tent He had placed among men,
And*ld delivered His strength into captivity, And*ld His glory into the enemy’s hand.
He*ld also gave His people over to the sword, And*ld was furious with His inheritance.
The*ld fire consumed their young men, And*ld their maidens were not given in marriage.
Their*ld priests fell by the sword, And*ld their widows made no lamentation.
Then*ln the Lord awoke as from*i sleep, Like*ld a mighty man who shouts because of wine.
And*ld He beat back His enemies; He*ld put them to a perpetual reproach.
Moreover*ln He rejected the tent of Joseph, And*ld did not choose the tribe of Ephraim,
But*ld chose the tribe of Judah, Mount*ld Zion which He loved.
And*ld He built His sanctuary like the heights, Like*ld the earth which He has established forever.
He*ld also chose David His servant, And*ld took him from the sheepfolds;
From*ld following the ewes that had young He brought him, To*ld shepherd Jacob His people, And*ld Israel His inheritance.
So*ld he shepherded them according to the integrity of his heart, And*ld guided them by the skillfulness of his hands.
